overview_of_class: This course introduces graduate students to rhetorical inquiry and cultural analysis as taken up in the Rhetoric and Public Culture program. Students enrolled in the proseminar will engage questions about the production, circulation, and reception of texts and practices. This includes becoming acquainted with the ways in which our program and affiliate faculty are engaged in a number of connected areas, including rhetoric as an intellectual tradition; oratory and performance; publics and publicity; democracy and globalization; visual culture; the politics of representation; emotion and affect; and media and culture.
name: Rhetoric and Public Culture Proseminar
subject: COMM_ST
